subject: Monthly Update - December
body:
Hey,

Welcome to your first real day on the job! You should have already received the first batch of requests in your inbox. Approve the people who you think need help the most, and remember we have limited funding! It's giving season, so donations were pretty good last month, leaving us with a budget of $10,000. December is always the best time for donations, so get excited for next month!

Good luck,
OctoAid Manager

subject: Need help staying afloat
body:
Dear OctoAid,

I'm Emma, and Iâ€™m reaching out because I'm on my last dollar. I'm unable to work due to my disability, and I've been waiting on my disability benefits decision for over 2 years. I have no income and have sold almost every posession I have. I recieve food stamps, but it isn't nearly enough, and I have no idea how I'm going to pay rent next month. I'm requesting $2,000 to cover the next 2 months of rent so I can stay housed. Please help.

Thank you for your consideration,
Emma Sullivan

subject: Recovering from broken arm
body:
Dear OctoAid,

I'm a full-time wheelchair-user, and I recently broke my arm while going down a dangerous ramp outside my building. I'm going to need around the clock care to get through my recovery, which is going to cost me $3,000 that I simply do not have. I hate having to ask like this, but is there any way you could help?

Thanks,
Sanjay

subject: Fibromyalgia treatment
body:
Hello OctoAid,

My name is Casey and I'm asking for $7,000 to cover the costs of treatment for my fibromyalgia. rTMS is a new treatment that could drastically reduce my pain and improve my quality of life, but it's not available through my insurance. This would be life changing for me, so I appreciate any help you can give.

Best,
Casey Joy

subject: Please save my cat!!
body:
Hi OctoAid,

I have a cat named Macaroni and he means the entire world to me. I'm autistic and have PTSD and Macaroni calms me during my meltdowns and provides so much love and support. He needs emergency surgery for a urinary obstruction and there's no way I can afford the $5,500 bill. Please please save my kitty, he's the only thing keeping me together.

Gratefully,
Sandra
